ISSUE.TITLE: remote: pod start empty pod: error without message
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ```console $ bin/podman-remote pod create --infra=false --name=foo a0cb944bf836e95ca0a83f98e1af151879552ac4fc424e29031c5f214227bdf6 $ bin/podman-remote pod start foo Error: ``` (That's it. Just "Error colon space"). The expected error message (from podman-local) is: ``` Error: no containers in pod a0cb944bf836e95ca0a83f98e1af151879552ac4fc424e29031c5f214227bdf6 have no dependencies, cannot start pod: no such container ```

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #22987 from edsantiago/exitwitherror-yetmore ExitWithError() - more upgrades from Exit()

COMMIT.MESSAGE: libpod API: return proper error status code for pod start When we failed to do anything we should return 500, the 409 code has a special meaing to the client as it uses a different error format. As such the remote client was not able to unmarshal the error correctly and just returned an empty string. Fixes #22989 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
